reviews.text: Clean modern rooms. Sraff were very nice. Restaurent had some good food
reviews.title: Good little hotel

reviews.text: THis hotel is certainly the best in Matane, especially if you ca have a good rate (around 80$, for me, and the breakfast is a very reasonable 8$, for good poached eggs and bacon). Biggest hotel in town, best location, seafront, near the main road (132) BUT away from it, so you won't hear the trucks at night (unlike the others hotels)
reviews.title: The waves in your room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room are very nice, newly refurbished, with new beds (awesome) and a very modern decor (simple, trendy, fluffy conforter, a red recliner with its ottoman). One of the things I liked best was the shower (in these redecorated rooms, you dont' have a bath): it is huge, with a rain-forest water system I have seen nowhere else ; divine, after a long day.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, with Euro modern style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: AND the best of all : you can open the window, so you have fresh air and the waves is all you hear as you slip into sleep (ask for renovated room, seaside, 2d floor). I also recommand a stroll on the beach just before going to bed : no crowd there ; just the sea.
reviews.title: Updates must have been made

reviews.text: This is the best place for a quiet and plaisant stay.
reviews.title: right on the beach!!

reviews.text: We were disappointed by this hotel. The room was recently refurbished in contemporary style and was pleasant with comfortable beds, which is obviously the first thing that you look for in a hotel , but despite the efforts in decoration, the whole place just seemed like a jumped up motel trying hard to pass itself off as a four star hotel.
reviews.title: Décus/ Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While there are all the services of a 4 star hotel, the place is located just off the main road north, and the 1980s motel style architecture and surrounding area ( despite the beach right in front) were downright depressing. It's no wonder the Riotel website doesn't show any significant exterior photos.
reviews.title: STAFF MADE THINGS GREAT

reviews.text: Finally, breakfast was decent but expensive for what we got, and served in the starchy dining room, albeit with a view of the Saint Lawrence.
reviews.title: A very pleasant stopover

reviews.text: We attended a family reunion at the end of August and this hotel was highly recommended to us by my niece who lives in Matane. After reading some of the comments, however, we were a bit leery of the place but decided to go ahead and we booked a room at the hotel.
reviews.title: Loved our stay at the Riotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a very pleasant drive from Montreal, some of it on the highway, some of it on the road along the St. Lawrence River, we were pleasantly surprised by the look of the hotel and its proximity to the water. We were given a room on the top floor overlooking the water which looks like the ocean this far down river. Although not very large, it was beautiful with extremely comfortable queen size bed and the best pillows I have slept on in a long time. Just falling asleep and waking up to the sound of the waves was marvelous. We never turned the TV on, not even once to watch the news (I'm a news freak).
reviews.title: Amazing sunsets!

reviews.text: Breakfast at the hotel was very good although one morning the toasts were on the cool side which was quickly remedied to. The bar and the dining room both overlook the water and have access to the pool, garden and the beach. The staff was very friendly and always smiling. Although we didn't have dinner there, we heard the food was excellent at night.
reviews.title: Poor value & very misrepresented on the net

reviews.text: Even if the weather was on the cool side, one day we wanted to go swimming. To our surprise, the heated outdoor pool was so warm it felt like being in the hot tub (there is one as well). We had a ball as other people joined us to enjoy the warm water.
reviews.title: Avoid - least enjoyable hotel night on 2 week trip to Quebec

reviews.text: We had a chance of meeting the owner of the hotel at a party during our stay and we told him how much we had appreciated our stay and mentioned our comfortable bed and particularly the famous pillows. I wish I could have left with them, although I told him I would, but of course I didn’t. He was very warm and friendly and made sure our stay at the hotel was perfect.
reviews.title: Excellent choice in Matane

reviews.text: I am travelling solo on motorcycle around the gaspe peninsula and the cnd maritimes.. my stay at the Matane Riotel was excellent.. all I wanted was a hot shower and a decent meal.

reviews.title: not a 4 star

I had a superb dinner with a view of te sunset and bonfire on the beach.. this was great.. if you stay there you must try the poched trout with a glass of Chardonnay... I higly recommend it. considering that the night before i satyed in a crappy motel that cost me the same as the Riotel.... this is a deal ! bon séjour !
It is a 3 star hotel and not a 4 star !!
